title: "How did Meri achieve the 'solar vision' by separating from the physical body during sleep?"
first_phrase: In the previous text, the author explored the concept of separating the lunar body from one's physical body to exist solely in the former. They believed that achieving this state led to an internal rebirth and the ability to avoid false paths. The author relied on intuition and instinct to guide them to this state, ultimately achieving a "solar vision" of absolute spiritual reality. In the final section, the author reflects on their experiences and notes that containing oneself within the physical body requires prior experiences of detachment. They conclude with acknowledging that their experience is difficult to describe and they have little else to add.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the process of achieving a state of inner light and connection with the cosmos may be difficult to articulate, but it is an experience that is deeply transformative and personal. By aligning our inner and outer selves, we can experience a profound sense of illumination and transcendence.
